data.question: What is the chemical formula of the nanoporous material discussed?
What is the yield percentage of the nanoporous material synthesis?
Can the aqua ligands in the channel linings of the nanoporous material be replaced?
data.answer: Yes, the aqua ligands can be replaced by pyridines.

data.question: What is the maximum thermal stability temperature of the nanoporous material?
What is the pore size of the nanoporous material?
Is the framework of the nanoporous material electrically neutral?
data.answer: Yes, the framework is electrically neutral.

data.question: What is the BET surface area of HKUST-1?
Does the synthesis of HKUST-1 involve high temperatures?
data.answer: Yes, synthesis at a higher temperature can promote the formation of polymer frameworks of higher dimensionality.

data.question: Can HKUST-1 be chemically functionalized without losing structural integrity?
data.answer: Yes, chemical functionalization can be achieved without a loss of structural integrity.

data.question: What is the accessible porosity percentage of HKUST-1?
Is HKUST-1 stable up to 500°C?
data.answer: No, HKUST-1 is stable up to 240°C.

data.question: What role do polar organic solvents play in the formation of HKUST-1?
data.answer: Polar organic solvents play a structure-directing role in the formation of the tetracarboxylate moieties.

data.question: Can the terminal axial water ligands in HKUST-1 be directed towards the interior of the nanopores?
data.answer: Yes, the terminal axial water ligands are directed from the Cu atoms to the interior of the nanopores.

data.question: What is the Langmuir surface area of HKUST-1?
Does the synthesis of HKUST-1 require a Te(cid:223)on-lined pressure vessel?
data.answer: Yes, the synthesis involves heating in a Te(cid:223)on-lined pressure vessel.

data.question: What is the formula unit for the experimentally determined absorption properties of HKUST-1?
data.answer: 10 additional water molecules per formula unit.

data.question: Is the cubic symmetry of HKUST-1's crystal directly created by the combination of tetracarboxylate unit and trimesic acid?
data.answer: No, the cubic symmetry is not directly created by the combination of these two.

data.question: What is the role of high temperature in the synthesis of HKUST-1?
data.answer: High temperature promotes the formation of polymer frameworks of higher dimensionality.

data.question: Can HKUST-1 rehydrate on exposure to air after dehydration?
data.answer: Yes, HKUST-1 rehydrates on exposure to air after dehydration.

data.question: What is the significance of the Cu-Cu internuclear separation in HKUST-1?
data.answer: It indicates the presence of dimeric cupric tetracarboxylate units in the framework.
